news.heading: Nepal enter U-16 final, to meet Malaysia for title
news.description: Nepal entered the final of the ACC U-16 Eastern Region Tournament with a four-wicket victory over Hong Kong at the Prem Tinsulanonda International School ground in Chiang Mai, Thailand on Saturday.Man-of-the-match Nikhil Kumar Singh picked up four wickets in an economical bowling display as Hong Kong were bundled out for just 86 runs in 32.2 overs. Nepal didn’t have big contributors in the game before they reached 87-6 in 21.4 overs. In the final on Sunday, Nepal will take on Malaysia.

news.heading: Nepal’s electric transport future is here
news.description: We have seen that electric public transportation can improve public health by reducing pollution,” says Sajha Yatayat Executive Director Bhushan Tuladhar. “Recent advances in electric transport provide the solution. What is sorely lacking in Nepal is political will, long-term commitment and strategic planning for electric mobility.

news.heading: Nepse index surges by 4.85 pc
news.description: Giving continuity to the five-week buoyancy, the country’s sole secondary market surged by 4.85 per cent or 59.81 points in the trading week between April 21 and 25.

news.heading: Drinking water taps at households of Panchthar
news.description: Under the campaign 'Ek Ghar Ek Dhara', water taps were installed in 57 houses of Barbote, Dadagaun, Kurumbha and Baghadhopa villages of the rural municipality, Panchthar. The drinking water project was implemented in the area by Kadoorie Agricultural Aid Association British Gurkhas Nepal with the investment of Rs. 5.25 million, where the locals contributed Rs. 1.2 million.

news.heading: Yoga in school curriculum
news.description: Realising the importance of Yoga, government is planning to incorporate it in school curriculum. Books related to yoga are also on the way. During Nepal-India Yoga Promotion program organised by Yoga University of America in Kathmandu, Nepal Academy chancellor Ganga Prasad Upreti stressed on the importance of yoga and how Nepal should be developed as a major hub for the practice and promotion of Yoga.

news.heading: Successful liver transplant in TUTC
news.description: Tribhuvan University Teaching Hospital(TUTC) has successfully conducted its first living donor liver transplantation. Transplant was done on 58 years old man suffering from liver cirrhosis from his 33 years old daughter's body by a team of doctors led by Dr Ramesh Singh Bhandari. TUTH is the second hospital to launch liver transplantion in Nepal after Sahid Dharma Bhakta National Transplant Centre, Bhaktapur. It costs around 25 lakh for the treatment.

news.heading: Constructing trekking route to link ABC
news.description: A trekking route to link the base camp of Annapurna Mountain is being constructed jointly by Annapurna rural municipality and the Department of Tourism. The DoT has allocated Rs. 2 million and the rural municipality Rs. 300 thousands in the current fiscal year for the trekking route. This work will ensure easy and safe travel for the trekkers.

news.heading: Farmers attracted towards Litchee Farming
news.description: Hetauda, June 3: Farmers of Makwanpurgadhi Rural Municipality, Makwanpur, are attracted towards commercial cultivation of litchee chinesis.Over 40 farmers at Makranchuli village Makwanpurgadhi Rural Municipality have cultivated litchee chinesis plants alone.One of these farmers is Uddhav Prasad Sapkota, manager of the Parijat Fruits, Herbs and Animals Farm. He has been cultivating three species of litchee since 1996 and currently has 45 litchee trees in his farm.
